go_data.justification: Desmin is localized at the level of the Z disk of the sarcomere.
Ubiquitylation by Trim32 causes coupled loss of desmin Z-bands, and thin filaments in muscle atrophy.
Desmin interacts with other myofibrillar proteins such as filamen, protein C, tropomyosin, troponin T, troponin I, titin, nebulin, vimentin, gelsolin, and vinculin.
